title.@value: Exposure to tobacco smoke in the perinatal period

definition.@value: Exposure to tobacco smoke in the perinatal period, both directly or through second hand smoke, can lead to: low birth weight, preterm delivery, Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS or cot death), spontaneous abortion, or intrauterine growth retardation.

label.@value: Fetus or newborn affected by maternal use of tobacco
Exposure to tobacco smoke in the perinatal period
